content.question: Two blocks, <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> and <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>, are attached together with a string and pulled up an incline by another string attached to Block <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>, as shown. The string between the blocks has a tension <math alttext="F sub T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>T</mtext></msub></math> and the other string attached to Block <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> has a tension <math alttext="F sub P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>P</mtext></msub></math>. There is negligible friction between the surface and the blocks. The free-body diagram of Block <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> is shown. Which of the following correctly identifies the force labeled <math alttext="F sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> in the free-body diagram and provides the correct justification?

choices.label: <math alttext="F sub 1 equals F sub P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>P</mtext></msub></math> because Block <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> is pulling the string down the incline.

<math alttext="F sub 1 equals F sub P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>P</mtext></msub></math> because the string attached only to Block <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> is also pulling Block <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> up the incline.

<math alttext="F sub 1 equals F sub T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>T</mtext></msub></math> because Block <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> is being pulled up the incline by the string which is attached to it.

<math alttext="F sub 1 equals F sub T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>T</mtext></msub></math> because the string between the blocks is pulling Block <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> down the incline.

content.answer: <math alttext="F sub 1 equals F sub T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>T</mtext></msub></math> because the string between the blocks is pulling Block <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> down the incline.
